Breckenridge Golf and Tennis Club Login Toggle navigation Menu Home About Us Homes for Sale/Lease Homeowners Homeowners Address Book Calendar Events Forms Requests Tennis/Pickleball Reservations Master Board Master Board Architectural Review Committee Board Certificates Board Sanctioned Committees Breckenridge Documents Breckenridge Survey Results (2025) Budget Contracts Financials/Audit Management Companies Master Board & Association Officers Master Board Minutes Master Insurances Meeting Video Links Weekly Report from Office Contact Us Contact Us Office Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 am to 4:00 pm Lunch Break: 12:00 pm to 12:30 pm Office Staff: Deborah Lisiewski- General Manager dlisiewski@castlegroup.com P: 239-992-5959 F: 239-948-0066 Job Summary: Supervisor of 6 employees, provide the financial and administrative duties, process/approve invoices, review the owner's account to ensure accounts are current and if not, follow-up emails/phone calls, forward pasted due accounts to attorney, solicit, analyze and negotiate contracts on behalf of the association. Maintain the association's financial record books, accounts, and other records as provided by the Association By-Laws and in accordance with Florida Statutes, as amended from time to time, and issue certificates of account/estoppel certificates. Assist with the Finance Committee in preparing an operating budget. Assist with our CPA on annual audit and provide all documentation, Prepare and send, as needed letters, reports, and notices as may be reasonably requested by the Board of Directors., and attend all meetings of the Board of Directors, as may be necessary, annual meeting, budget meeting and any other general membership meetings of the Association. Perform routine property inspections and make written recommendations to the Board of Directors for maintenance and improvements to the common property. P: 239-992-5959 F: 239-948-0066 Job Summary: Supports the Property Manager on site with any delegated administrative, financial, or operational tasks. Preps for board meetings and set up the packages, zoom, and send out email communications. Prepare board minutes. Maintain the activities account and assists the lifestyle director with event budgeting. Complete deposits, refund checks, and end-of-month reports for the accounting department. Collect/put together items for the weekly reports. Handle merchandise and office supply inventory. Work with committee members on updating information and handling part of the workload: ARC and Storage Lot committee, work with the most. Collect and process rental applications. Provides training for new hires. Assists with investigations, and tap/log reviews for any unusual incidents. Maintains office spreadsheets, logs, records, and forms. Resolves and follow-ups with all complaints/issues and reports to the Property Manager. Create and send out email blast communications to residents when needed. Handles new homeowner orientations. Attend mandatory meetings when needed. Complete Castle Training. Work with rangers on parking violations. Maintain the community website. Answers phones promptly and assists residents with questions, and concerns, signing for events, providing gate equipment, and any other tasks they may need assistance with. Marilyn Juan -  Administrative Assistant mjuan@castlegroup.com P: 239-992-5959 F: 239-948-0666 Job Summary: Answers phones promptly and assists residents with questions and concerns. Inputs/processed work orders and guest passes submitted through the website. Maintain association files. Provide and program gate access to residents. Maintain homeowner roaster, database, mail instructions, and homeowner files. Assists with the rental application process as well as with processing new homeowners. Plan and execute all association events but not limited to reservations, ticket sales, facilitation preparation, and on occasion work with residents on events. Work with the Assistant Property Manager to maintain the event budget. Create Activity reports for each event. Create flyers and send out event information via email to owners. Attending and hosting clubhouse-sponsored events. Negotiate contracts with food vendors and entertainment. Maintain completed and current files of all events and reservations. Updated community website and channel. Prepare weekly items to give to the assistant property manager. Create the monthly newsletter. Complete tasks/duties delegated by supervisors. Maintenance Staff: Steadmon Allen- Maintenance Manager sallen@castlegroup.com P: 239-850-9262 Job Summary: Supervisor to 3 employees, the Maintenance Supervisor is responsible for the daily supervision of Maintenance Staff. He is responsible for department organization, performing maintenance checks, supervising the inspection of all mechanical sections of the building, and reporting to building management in all areas. The Maintenance Supervisor is also responsible for the seamless running of all the building mechanics, HVAC, pools, cleanliness, organization of these areas, and maintaining a team of energized and motivated Assist with hurricane preparation of the property. Steve Nick  Maintenance Tech Steve 1: Every Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday, Steve from our maintenance crew helps maintain the bocce courts to ensure they are properly taken care of. Every morning a maintenance staff member cleans the trash and pine needles off the pool deck. Along with wiping down the tables Painting or touching up all common areas as needed. Makes general carpentry, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, and other minor community/building repairs, and maintains records and other maintenance reports as directed by supervisor. Reports needed for major repairs to Community Association Manager Maintenance Supervisor. Checks all lighting daily, Pressure washes decks, sidewalks, and entrances, as necessary to maintain a neat appearance, and assists with hurricane preparation of the property. Larry Milewski Maintenance Tech Larry 2: Every day, Larry from the maintenance staff checks the chemical and sanitation levels for all the pools and spas. If there needs to be any adjustments made, then he will do so. Along with checking the levels, he checks the flow meters, psi, and vacuum gages and will clean the filters if they are not accurate. These are tasks that are not done daily but regularly are checking the Sprinkler Zones and making repairs if needed. The sprinkler meter readings for all of Breckenridge are done once a month and given to the office to submit to the county on a quarterly basis. Assist with hurricane preparation of property. Clemente Diego Maintenance Tech Clemente 3: Clemente opens the clubhouse and pools every week morning. He also comes up to the clubhouse daily to take the trash out, replace paper goods, and ensures that during the day the clubhouse stays clean for our residents. In the mornings and sometimes throughout the day, he will clean the pool bathrooms and ensure the trash cans are not full. On a daily basis when maintenance is driving around for their work, if they see any branches or palm fawns in the general area/golf course, they will pick them up. Assist with hurricane preparation of property. Rangers: Ranger Phone: 239-850-9264 John Conrad Chris Harris Bob Johnson Arty Martinez Job Summary: With every shift each ranger checks in with the office to see if any specific duties need to be handled. Rangers check each amenity to ensure residents/guests/renters are registered and following the rules. Reports violations to the property manager and fills out daily ranger logs to report the work they do. Check golf carts and vehicles for proper and current stickers, if not in compliance a warning ticket is issued. Enforces rules of no runners, walkers, or bikers on the golf cart path. Check the golfer's sign-in sheets and turn them in to the office. Be on the lookout for underage drivers on golf carts. check first aid kits at the pools/clubhouse. Assist and educate owners and guests.  Opening and closing of the pools and clubhouse. In constant communication with the office during their shift and perform any duties required by management. About The Breck HOA and Property Management Team Home Communities Availability Services Owners HOA Online Portals Residents Owners HOA About Contact Pay Rent Home Communities Availability Services Owners HOA Online Portals Residents Owners HOA About Contact Pay Dues About Us Qualified Experts, Local Knowledge. As a member of the Community Associations Institute, and holder of the Certified Manager of Communications designation (CMCA), Breckenridge Resort Managers is your trusted and qualified resource for management of your Homeowners Association. With our own in-house cleaning and maintenance staff, professional accounting systems and partners, and a dedication to punctual and professional management, we can quickly convert your association from passively, to actively managed within months. Our management does not stop with paying bills and fixing issues reported to us. We actively seek out ways to improve operations, budget, and planning components of your HOA, giving your ownership comfort in knowing their association is primed for success. We employ proper maintenance and reserve schedules for all of our HOA’s, ensure appropriate reserve funding, look closely after budgets, and discover maintenance issues before they become assessments. If you are looking for active, professional, and uniquely qualified HOA management, please contact us to see how we can help you find a better solution for the needs of your association. Our job is your community. CONTACT US Toby Babich President & CEO Toby began his real estate career in 2001 as Realty Executives 100 agent, with a specialization in residential sales and valuations. In 2003, he and his wife, Lauretta, founded Realty Executives Integrity First. The startup company quickly grew into one of the most prominent brokerages in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. As the principal owner and manager of the brokerage, Toby oversaw all aspects of marketing, finances, portfolio management, and operations. In 2008, Lauretta and Toby relocated back to Breckenridge, Toby's hometown. In the Breckenridge area, Toby finds fulfillment through community and industry involvement, holding some of the most prominent certifications in the real estate industry, as well as seats on many boards and committees. Toby is a member of the Community Associations institute, where he holds Certified Manager of Community Associations designation as well as an Association Management Specialist designation. Additionally, Toby is an experienced real estate agent, holding an active Colorado License with a Resort and Second homes Property Specialist certification. Toby spends his free time with his wonderful family, skiing, working on and riding in his jeep, and volunteering his time to serve Breckenridge. Lauretta Babich General Manager Lauretta oversees all aspects of reservations, housekeeping, owner services, guest services, and general operations. She is a graduate of Louisiana State University with a major in communications, holds a Colorado real estate license with a Resort and Second Homes Property Specialist (RSPS) designation, and is an active member of the Breckenridge Community. Lauretta truly enjoys people, and demonstrates proficient levels of customer service, but makes it look effortless. In her spare time, she enjoys raising her three little ones, belly dancing, and enjoying our mountain community. 970-453-9551 owner@rmlodging.com 100 S Main St, Breckenridge, CO 80424, 9am - 5pm, Monday - Friday Online Portal Log In | Sign Up Owner Portal Log In | Sign Up Sitemap | Accessibility © All Rights Reserved. About - Grand Harbor Golf and Beach Club Skip to content Skip to content MEMBER LOGIN Home About Membership Golf Beach Club Tennis Dining Experiences Fitness Contact Us OUR STORY CONTINUOUSLY ELEVATING CLUB LIFE FOR OUR MEMBERSHIP Our membership is at the heart of our story. Everything we do is designed to enhance their club experience. Located in beautiful Vero Beach, we provide unparalleled opportunities for leisure and recreation. From our two thoughtfully designed and exciting golf courses to the tranquil expanse of our Beach Club, every day at Grand Harbor is a chance to live exceptionally. EXPERIENCE GRAND HARBOR OUR STAFF Michael Gibson General Manager LEARN MORE Troy Pare Director of Golf LEARN MORE Josh Breda Director of Agronomy LEARN MORE Rico Hosena Beach Club Executive Chef LEARN MORE Joe Ferro Executive Chef LEARN MORE Tim Blouin Executive Pastry Chef LEARN MORE Marco Osorio Director of Sports LEARN MORE Jodi Vogt Director of Membership LEARN MORE Matt depino Director of Facilities and Construction TONY ALBANO Manager of Information Systems Donna rainbow Beach Club Manager Walter Ruiz F&B Operations Manager Robby Gutermuth Clubhouse Operations Manager Joel Brown Assistant F&B Manager Andrian Bitere Manager in Development Jennifer Moore Chief Financial Officer Joy Hernandez Director of Human Resources Grand Harbor is indeed GRAND with an amazing membership and staff! Deb Fletcher, Grand Harbor Member EXPERIENCE GRAND HARBOR Clubhouse: 4985 Club Terrace, Vero Beach, Florida 32967 772-778-9000 Beach Club: 8500 Highway A1A, Vero Beach, Florida 32963 772-231-2600 Twitter Instagram Facebook-f Phone-alt Envelope Quick Links About Membership Membership Portal Terms of Service Contact Us INQUIRE TODAY First Name Last Name Email Address Message SUBMIT ©2025 Grand Harbor Golf & Beach Club. All Rights Reserved Michael Gibson General Manager Michael Gibson’s professional achievements span over three decades of excellence in the golf and hospitality industry. He has been a dedicated member of the CMAA Seminole Region Charity Golf Tournament Committee over 25 years, showcasing his commitment to charitable causes. Michael served as General Manager at Old Marsh Golf Club, where he helped achieve six years of Platinum Clubs of America status and Emerald Distinguished Club honors. He participated in the 2014 Boca Ballroom Battle, raising over $50,000 for the George Snow Scholarship Fund. Under his leadership, Boca Grove was named a Top 100 Golf Shop by the Association of Golf Merchandisers in 2019 and won Country Club of the Year from Luxury Travel Guide. Michael has served as General Manager of Grand Harbor Golf & Beach Club for nearly four years, following the transition from developer ownership to a member-owned club. During his tenure, the Club has gained 400+ new members, and his leadership was instrumental in earning the Distinguished Clubs of America award. Michael’s dedication to the Club and its members is unwavering, continuously enhancing the member experience. Living grand has never been better! Troy Pare Director of Golf at Grand Harbor Troy Pare, originally from Rhode Island, has been a golf professional for 27 years, with 17 years as a Head Golf Professional/Director of Golf. He began his current role as Director of Golf at Grand Harbor Golf and Beach Club in Vero Beach, Florida, on March 4, 2021, where he also works on the membership team. Prior to Grand Harbor, Troy served as Head Golf Professional at Ledgemont Country Club and as Director of Operations & Head Golf Professional at The Preserve at Boulder Hills, a private club offering outdoor activities like golf, hunting, and fly fishing. He was also the Head Golf Professional at Wannamoisett Country Club in Rumford, Rhode Island. Married for 23 years with two teenage boys, Troy thrives in the busy, multi-tasking environment of Grand Harbor. Josh Breda Director of Agronomy Josh Breda is the Director of Agronomy at Grand Harbor, bringing over 24 years of experience in agronomy and golf course maintenance. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Turfgrass Science from Clemson University and has previously worked at renowned clubs such as The Ford Plantation in Richmond Hill, GA, The Savannah Golf Club, The Polo Club in Boca Raton, and Riddell’s Bay Golf Club in Warwick, Bermuda. With a passion for working outdoors and a love for the game of golf, Josh finds his favorite aspect of working at Grand Harbor to be the close-knit team atmosphere and the opportunity to maintain beautiful, world-class golf courses. His day-to-day responsibilities include overseeing all aspects of turf management, coordinating with the grounds team, and ensuring the courses are in top condition for members and guests throughout the year. Rico Hosena Executive Chef at Grand Harbor Chef Rico Hosena has been in the kitchen since 1989, working and training with chefs from all over the world. He started working for the five-star luxury resort, Sofitel Philippine Plaza Manila. This is where Rico learned to be versatile in all food and beverage operations, starting as a cook and then learning the ropes as a waiter and guest services professional. In 2007 Rico came to America on an H2B program, where he met Michael Gibson working at Old Marsh Golf Club. Every six months, he would travel north and work at other restaurants and Clubs including Kiawah Island, Mountain Air Country Club and Martha’s Vineyard. In April 2021, Rico had the opportunity to join Michael again when he was offered the position as Executive Chef of the Beach Club. Rico’s goal has been to elevate the dining experience by offering exceptional restaurant-quality food, breaking away from the typical country club fare. With his team, he is turning the vision of creating the best restaurant in Vero Beach into a reality. Joe Ferro Executive Chef Joe began his career in Buffalo, NY at popular restaurants Le Metro Bistro and Bakery and The Left Bank, expanding his culinary knowledge in these scratch kitchens. He soon became Executive Chef at the historic Buffalo Launch Club, the world’s oldest power boating club. Following his passion for food and cooking, he moved to South Florida. Eventually he joined the team at Table 26, later taking over as Executive Chef. Years later he moved on the The Club at Admirals Cove (AC) as Executive Sous Chef. After five years at AC, Joe took on the role of Executive Chef at Grand Harbor. Joe aims to leave his culinary mark by creating a home where his creative vision and extensive expertise can flourish. His ability to blend traditional techniques with modern flair sets him apart, making him a standout in the industry. Tim Blouin Executive Pastry Chef Tim Blouin began his career at Grand Harbor in 2001, though his culinary journey started long before that. Originally from Nashua, New Hampshire, Tim discovered his passion for cooking in high school, studying Culinary Arts. He went on to attend New Hampshire College Culinary Institute and briefly trained at a culinary school in Northern France. His early career was filled with seasonal work, spending summers at The Harbor View Hotel on Martha’s Vineyard and winters at The Village at Breckenridge in Colorado. Tim’s true passion for pastry ignited when he trained under Master Pastry Chef Steven James at The Balsams Grand Resort in Dixville Notch, New Hampshire. Chef James introduced him to pastry competitions and arranged opportunities to work with top pastry chefs during the off-seasons at prestigious locations such as Mohonk Mountain House in New York, The Cloister on Sea Island in Georgia, Kingsmill Resort in Virginia, and The American Club in Wisconsin. Tim eventually found his way to Vero Beach, Florida, after visiting a friend working at Windsor, and the rest is history. Tim is one of Grand Harbor’s “sweetest” assets, bringing passion and expertise to every creation. With his personal touch, each dessert becomes a true masterpiece! Marco Osorio Director of Sports With a career spanning over 20 years, Marco has a unique background as an ATP player, high-performance coach, tournament organizer, and club manager. He reached the top 200 in both singles and doubles and, as a Davis Cup player for Mexico, claimed victories over Roger Federer and the Bryan brothers. After retiring from professional tennis, Marco became one of Mexico’s top high-performance coaches, mentoring multiple national champions and serving as Davis Cup Captain. Marco has also organized over 50 world-class tournaments, earning five International Tennis Federation (ITF) awards for hosting the best “Grade A” tournaments globally—events as prestigious as the Grand Slams. In club management, he served as COO of Mexico’s largest sports club organization and successfully turned around the Vero Beach Tennis Club after purchasing it in 2011. He later became General Manager of the Boulevard. Since 2018, Marco has worked at Grand Harbor, first as Head Tennis Professional and then as Tennis Director. In 2021, he took on a dual role as Sports Director and Tournament Director for the Vero Beach International Tennis Open. Marco also holds three graduate degrees, including an MBA, and frequently speaks at sports and tennis conferences worldwide. Jodi Vogt Director of Membership Jodi is the Director of Membership at Grand Harbor, where she finds joy in both welcoming prospective members and building lasting relationships with current ones. She enjoys meeting new people, giving tours of the club, and sharing the unique experiences Grand Harbor has to offer. Along with handling the membership application process, Jodi ensures a smooth and personalized experience for each new member. With a background in psychology, sociology, and nonprofit management, Jodi brings a warm and thoughtful approach to her work, making every member feel welcome and appreciated at Grand Harbor.

The mall offers onsite restrooms, a loading dock, heated sidewalk and plaza, main street frontage, and a beautiful interior common area with elevator and skylight. The building consists of 44 individually owned residential units. The building features plenty of storage, forced air conditioning, common stairwells and an elevator, and plenty of parking. The two buildings consist of 30 individually owned condos. Wendell Square A commercial and residential complex in Breckenridge, Colorado located in on Ridge Street. It has 4 commercial units on the first floor facing Ridge Street and 4 residential units on the second story with private parking behind the complex, including a one-car garage for each residential unit. The bundled golf community includes coach homes, attached villas, townhomes and condominiums. All homes have lake or golf course views. Community amenities include an 18-hole, Par 3 golf course, a fitness facility, five heated swimming pools and eight Har-Tru tennis courts as well as pickleball facilities. Breckenridge is located in Estero west of US 41, between Pine Road and Broadway Avenue West. primarily have two types of golf memberships in the area; Bundled Golf and Golf Equity or Membership Golf. In the Bonita Springs and Estero Florida area some of the gated communities are built around and showcase the amenity of golf.  Homes and condos are built with golf course views and offer a variety of ways to become a member or play the golf course. Golf equity or membership golf means that there is golf available with the purchase of a membership.  The membership purchase is usually optional and each community charges a different rate for their equity, plus annual fees as well as greens, cart or trail fees. Bundled golf means that every home owner in the community automatically becomes a member of the golf club.  If you aren’t a serious golfer a bundled golf community may not be the first choice.  Membership has its privileges but it also comes with mandatory fees on a recurring, annual basis.  Depending upon the community fees, at this time, begin around $10,000 per year and up, plus trail or greens fees. If you’re looking for bundled golf communities in Bonita Springs or Estero, Florida here is a list of neighborhoods that offer golf with the purchase of real estate.  All of the bundled golf communities below offer single family homes as well as condominiums.  Highland Woods, Worthington and Spring Run also have attached villa homes, as well as, condominiums and single family villa homes. Breckenridge is made up of 842 units, including condos, villas, and coach homes that overlook 5 lakes.  Our outdoor amenities include 5 swimming pools, an 18-hole Par 3 bundled golf course, 8 lighted HAR TRU tennis courts, 3 pickleball courts, 6 shuffleboard courts and 3 bocce courts. Indoor amenities include a fitness room, a library, a catering kitchen, and a large common area and lanai. To view more information on our amenities, see below for photos and brief descriptions. The clubhouse offers numerous regularly scheduled activities such as bingo, knitting, exercise classes, bridge, euchre, poker, and other card groups.  Special events vary but include themed parties and dinner dances with live entertainment! Whether renters, part-time or full-time residents, Breckenridge provides a warm and welcoming environment where residents take pride in our community and truly care about our neighbors! Bocce Courts We have 3 Bocce Courts adjacent to the main pool.  Equipment is provided. Fitness Room (view 1) Fitness Room (view 2) The Fitness Room is located inside the Clubhouse and is accessible every day from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm.  It is open to residents, renters, and their guests. Lanai (View 1) Lanai (View 2) Lanai (View 3) A beautiful view, no matter what angle of the lanai you choose to sit. You can watch tennis players, view the lake or enjoy the pool side. Golf Course We offer a private 3 par Golf Course with 18 holes.  Golf Scrambles & open golf is open to all residents, tenants & tenants' guests. Golf Range & Putting Ring The Golf Range is located at Hole #10 (behind the tennis courts). Horseshoes The Horseshoe pit is located behind the tennis courts by golf course hole #10. Ping Pong The Ping Pong table is located on the Lanai of the Breckenridge Clubhouse. The paddles and balls are hanging on at the end of one of the tables underneath. Pools Clubhouse Main Pool Clubhouse Hot Tub The main pool with the hot tub is located at the clubhouse.  The remaining 4 pools are located throughout the community and can be viewed on the Breckenridge Property Map . Shuffle Board Courts There are 6 Shuffle Board Courts adjacent to the clubhouse.  The equipment is located in the storage shed by the courts. Pickleball Courts There are 3 Pickleball courts. Residents & Renters can make online reservations 5 days in advance. Tennis Courts There are 8 Tennis Courts.  Court #8 is equipped with a ball machine.  Residents & Renters can make online reservations 5 days in advance.
